data.title: Turlough Brian O'Brien (-1459)

data.text:
Turlough Brian O'Brien aka King of Thomond

Born [date unknown] in Munster, Ireland

Ancestors

[sibling(s) unknown]

[spouse(s) unknown]

Descendants

Father of Teige-an-Chomhaid (O'Brien) O'Briain

Died 1459 in Munster, Ireland

Profile last modified 14 Mar 2023 | Created 13 Jul 2015

This page has been accessed 1,798 times.

Biography

Toirdelbhach Bóg Ó Briain (Turlough O'Brien), hero of Glen Fogarty and Ballyanfoil, was King of Thomond from 1444/1446 until his death in 1459.

He was a son of Brian Sreamhach Ó Briain and Sláine Nic Con Mara [MacNamara].

"At a time of fierce hostility with battles raging throughout Leinster and Munster, Turlogh O'Brien and MacWilliam of Clanrickard defeated James FitzGerald, 6th Earl of Desmond.[1] in battle at Gleanfogata and Ballyanfoil."[2]

Toirdelbhach Bóg Ó Briain married Catherine Burke, a daughter of Ulick FitzWalter Burke.[3] and their children included:

Teige

Donogh-Teige, bishop of Killaloe[4][5]

Connor Mor na-Shrona, ancestor of O'Brien of Sealhendhe, in Clare

Turlogh Oge, who was called "Gilla Dubh" because of his dark complexion and who was the progenitor of O'Brien, of Ballymacdoody

Mahon of Kilclaney

Kennedy

Brian Ganeagh

Murtogh Beg

Sources

↑ Wikipedia: James Fitzgerald Earl of Desmond

↑ True Stories from the History of Ireland p.330, series 1-3, published 1829 by John James MACGREGOR the Elder

↑ entry 118 in The Irish landed gentry when Cromwell came to Ireland (Irish Landed Gentry Entered at Stationers' Hall) publisher M.H. Gill & Son, Dublin (1881), p.125

↑ Donnchadh mac Toirdhealbhaigh Ó Briain, also known as Donogh-Teige or Terence, was the son of Turlough, King of Thomond (d.1459) and served from 1443 (appointment) to 1460 (death). He succeeded by Papal provision. He was killed by Brian-an-Chobhlaigh (Brian of the Fleet), son of Donogh O’Brien of Clonroad, in 1460.

James Frost, The History and Topography of the County of Clare, Chapter 10: Ui Toirdhealbhaigh, citing Ware's Irish Bishops:

http://www.clarelibrary.ie/eolas/coclare/history/frost/chap10_st_flannan.htm

↑ http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/bishop/bobriendn.html

Wikipedia: List of the Monarchs of Thomond

Wikipedia: Toirdhealbhach Bóg Ó Briain, King of Thomond from 1446-1459
